TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP pictures!

Articles.Content:
cant resist the lens flares JJ was right they make things more awesome

souz mrs-g getting tested on the north pole for a future mission to duna

mss-flare ( a lighter version) getting tested at the kerbal space center, future mission dres

hey u still around? make some more rovers pleaseeee!!
Bop and my multi-environmental science probe in the foreground, with Jool, Laythe, Tylo and Vall in the background.
Soooo.......jetpacks have to be researched......sorry buddy, have a nice float.
How did you get the IVA view of the kerbal?

Shuttle Carrier craft

Gilly

Delty IV heavy

Falcon Heavy

Manned ship at Moho

- "But...but...jetpacks don't have to be reaserched..."

- "Dammit. Well, getting rid of Jeb isn't so easy. Time for the concealed K4 detonation!"

[bANG!!!]

- "Helooooooooo!!!"

- "Jeb! Damn You! Why won't you just DIE and let us live without the risk of falling rockets all the time!!!"
Mir is a busy place today.

Mir is a busy place today.

-snip-

Wow. That is fantastic.
Bob got stuck in the ladder. I am laughing so hard right now.

Built a station.... Ill send up a BOSS Camera soon so i can take a better screenshot.

Its got 2 Skylabs, 8 transmitters, 4 hitch hikers, a full orange tank+ a supply thingy, 7 gigantors (One got smashed by debris) And two tugs... My first one got super glued due to lag onto the station. Took 3 days with mechjeb assistance to build this sucker.

movie reference

Skylab heatshield inspection

This little spitfire of an aircraft could do it all! Loops, Immelmann Turns, endless Barrel Rolls .... Everything, except hold the engine on after landing! This was all well and good if we're landing back at KSC, but what about SCIENCE! expeditions that could use the engine after landing for, you know, returning? Introducing, THE LANDING-ONLY LANDING GEAR!!!

I added this third wheel to the back, under the engine, and removed it from the 'Gear' action group, and inserted it in an action group of its own. This way, I can have it retracted for take-off, and extended for landing! The engineers back at KSC are real proud of this one, saves a lot of engines! Happy flying!

I had to do the same thing:

Even just sending this to the runway almost broke off the jet engine. Added the extra landing gear, moved their control to a separate action group so they can retract/extend separately from the main gear. Since I'm terrible at landing, I added the parachutes to deploy and float the plane to the ground, which before I added the extra landing gear, always snapped off the engine.

A couple shots of it in flight:

Crossing the mountains

Flying over the edge of the northern ice sheet on the way to the north pole:

The first iteration of the plane before I added the second set of wings which gave it much more lift and a lot easier to fly. Neither is very fancy considering the massive things other people put in the air, but this is the first plane I've made that works fairly well, plus it was made pretty early in the career mode game.

Bill: I knew I shouldn't have let you drive.

Bob:But Jeb dared me that I couldn't jumped the pyramid.

Bill: And what did I tell you about Jeb's dares?

Bob: That they are things even he isn't crazy enough to do.
My Favorite Kerbal from my .20 save has come back!

A few days ago, someone said they hadn't seen an "authentic" Apollo CSM in KSP. I think this one looks OK.

Here she is making a vodka delivery.

There's also this baby, very reasonably priced. One owner, and they only took it to the Mun on Sundays.

Edited October 24, 2013 by Jack Wolfe

My Favorite Kerbal from my .20 save has come back!

Lars? He was one of my first pilots ever! All the way back in .16!

Here she is making a vodka delivery.

gravity reference?

Lars? He was one of my first pilots ever! All the way back in .16!

Lars is a key Kerbal of mine as well! I copy him into my number one kerbal position for each of the new expansions. Is leading my science program.

Doubles as a picnic table!

My first Minmus landing ever! I even remembered to bring enough fuel to get home!

(however, I completely forgot to put enough parachutes on the craft to land safely back on Kerbin)

Finished the science tree and built a new Service Module for my Springbok VII (appolo like Mun Mission) and started with a minibuggy to figure out these components for when I start building my Mun/Duna Base :-)

Mir is a busy place today.

Is that from the Mir craft file pack? Does it include a preassembled station?

gravity reference?

The film? Afraid not. I haven't seen it yet.

Is that from the Mir craft file pack? Does it include a preassembled station?

It's BobCat's Mir. Yes, it has a pre-baked craft file, but I didn't use it. That's why we have the Proton.
